message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.NE, cs.GT. 

This paper deals with distributed consensus in a network, which is a topic in distributed computing (cs.DC). The problem of achieving consensus with many opinions is also related to social networks and opinion dynamics, which fall under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) in analyzing the convergence time of the protocol. The use of majority dynamics is related to game theory (cs.GT) and the study of voting systems. Finally, the presence of an adaptive, malicious adversary brings in elements of network security and intrusion detection (cs.NE).
